cluster_relations.rel_desc: Urban legends are described as continuing to endure over time.
The news report provides information about the escaped criminal.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a concept or entity possesses a specific property or characteristic represented as a separate node.
args.justification: The relation links 'urban legends' to 'endurance of urban legends', which is a property/quality node describing a characteristic of the subject; a generic property-predication like 'has_property' is appropriate and reusable.
This edge expresses an attribution of a quality (endurance) to an entity (urban legends), fitting an attribute/quality family of relations.
The broad semantics are that of describing an inherent quality or property rather than composition, causality, or hierarchy.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an information-bearing entity (e.g., document, report, narrative) is about or describes a particular entity or topic.
args.justification: The relation connects a 'news report' to an 'escaped criminal', with the description stating the report provides information about the criminal; this is a standard aboutness/content relation best captured as 'is_about'.
This edge encodes the topical/content relation between an information source (news report) and its subject (escaped criminal), which fits an aboutness/content-description relation class.
The primary semantics are informational: the news report conveys information about the escaped criminal, so the relation belongs under a broad information/content group.
